page.title: 17Ivy House Farm, Elton
page.content: This farm is run by father and son. The farmhouse is in the centre of Elton whilst the land is to the south and west of the village. It is 100 acres in size. There are 50 dairy cattle, 30 beef cattle and also calves raised as replacement dairy cows. There are 86 sheep and lambs on grazing land in Gratton. Free-range hens are kept. Some silage is cut but hay, stored in bales, is the main grass crop. The farmer's day is from 6.00 a.m. until 8.00 p.m., later during calving and hay-making times.
